project.name: Gentoo/AMD64 ATs
project.description: The Gentoo/AMD64 AT Project is devoted to help the developers with time-consuming testing.

longdescription.p: The Gentoo/AMD64 Arch Testers (ATs) assist the developers with the time-consuming testing to help keeping the Portage tree up to date. They mainly communicate with the developers through Gentoo's Bugzilla and IRC. The ATs are also on the amd64@gentoo.org mail alias so they can watch the bugzilla traffic closely.

body.p: We are constantly looking for new arch testers. If you meet the following criterias, you are likely our ideal candidate:

ul.li: You like tinkering around with new software.
You want to get involved in Gentoo development, help to make the distribution better every day.

body.p: If you want to participate, email hparker@gentoo.org or dang@gentoo.org. They will lead you through the process and help you with the ebuild quiz which is a requirement for all ATs.
body.note: Arch testers are not official Gentoo developers. They are, however, a recognized part of the Gentoo/AMD64 arch team.

body.p: There are a few rules which must be followed to assure a certain quality level. Gentoo/AMD64 arch testers must fulfill these requirements:

ul.li: Use a stable system or a stable chroot environment for testing
Enable at least the following FEATURES: multilib-strict, collision-protect, sandbox, test
Before requesting a stablization, check that the ebuild is at least 30 days old and without modifications
Use the category/package-version format when reporting success or failure
Always append emerge --info to bug reports
